sentences.english: Sometimes we do play it around the penalty area too much.
sentences.chinese: 有時我們的球確實在罰球區周圍活動太多了。

sentences.english: Shot was a free kick of 60 meters away.
sentences.chinese: 奇拉維特罰球的經典之作是60。

sentences.english: When Minny shot 40 total free throws… the Rox 19 for the whole game.
sentences.chinese: 森林狼全場獲得40次罰球，而火箭只有19次。

sentences.english: Do you have free throw for hacking in half-court game?
sentences.chinese: 你們打半場打手犯規罰球嗎？

sentences.english: Which means that a goalkeeper has to start moving before the kicker’s foot meets the ball.
sentences.chinese: 這就是說守門員必須在罰球運動員觸球之前開始移動。

sentences.english: As team captain, Darius volunteered to take the shots.
sentences.chinese: 作爲隊長，達利斯主動請纓去罰球。

sentences.english: They were getting to the (free throw) line and putting a lot of pressure on us.
sentences.chinese: 對手總是在罰球線附近給我們施加強大的壓力。

sentences.english: Yao layup. Mike James missed free throw.
sentences.chinese: 姚明上籃，詹姆斯錯失罰球。

sentences.english: Free advantage in favor of the Blazers who made 25 of their 37 attempts.
sentences.chinese: 開拓者今天抓住了在罰球線上的機會，37罰25中。

sentences.english: As team captain, Darius 8)volunteered to take the shots.
sentences.chinese: 作爲隊長，達利斯主動出來投射罰球。

sentences.english: Usually we don't miss free-throws like that.
sentences.chinese: 通常我們不會像今天一樣錯失罰球。

sentences.english: We were awarded a free-throw shot, and you missed it.
sentences.chinese: 我們被裁決有一次罰球，而你卻失誤沒罰進。

sentences.english: Flatley kicked a penalty in the 97th minute, and the score drew level once again at 17-all.
sentences.chinese: 弗拉特里在第97分鐘時一記罰球又將比分扳平。

sentences.english: The Wilt went to the line and made the three-point play.
sentences.chinese: 然後威爾特走上罰球線，罰中，完成打三分。

sentences.english: Would you want him taking FTs at the end?
sentences.chinese: 你會希望他來執行最後的罰球嗎？

sentences.english: Blake does a lot of what Fisher quietly does well on offense.
sentences.chinese: 布雷克能在罰球上和老魚做的一樣好。

definition: (soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
half of a game or contest/half-court
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
